builders.description: Macros suitable for WoW 1.12.3 or later (WoW Classic, or WoW TBC and later)
builders.name: ISBoxer 2 Core WoW Macros

gameMacroSheets.name: ISBoxer 2 Core WoW Macros
gameMacroSheets.description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 42

macros.name: FTLAssist
macros.description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

macros.name: FTLFocus
macros.description: Sets the Focus Target to a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

macros.name: /focus {FTL}'s target
macros.description: Sets the Focus Target to a specific character's Target, depending on the optional modifiers included.

macros.name: FTLFollow
macros.description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

macros.name: FTLTarget
macros.description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

macros.name: InviteTeam
macros.description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

macros.name: CTMOn
macros.description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

macros.name: JambaMaster
macros.description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

macros.name: JambaStrobeOn
macros.description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

macros.name: JambaStrobeOff
macros.description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.

macros.name: /console reloadui
macros.description: Reloads the WoW interface. This will activate any ISBoxer WoW Macro changes made (after an Export while playing). If you want to use this, you will need either a Key Combination, or a /click button name!
